poem:
### Daily Alleviations

Scrunch those shoulders as if hiding,  
two minutes to catch a slice of calm.  
Hold the world taut, inhaling patience,  
then let go as breath becomes a balm.  
Your eyes strain from digital gazes,  
like stretching toward distant lands.  
Exhale tension into morning's grasp,  
unfurl your time, unclench your hands.
